node.text:
Today, World Bank marks #IndigenousPeoplesDay!

We asked Indigenous leaders about some of the solutions emerging from their communities during COVID-19.

Hear what Pasang Dolma Sherpa, from Nepal, had to say. 

 #Road2Inclusion

node.text: The @WorldBank Group does not open individual bank accounts, have ATMs 🏧, or give personal loans 💳. So what are we? Our new series "Since you asked" 💬 answers YOUR questions!

node.title: What is the World Bank Group?

node.text: Young people have been hit hard by #COVID19. In the world’s poorest countries, their ideas and innovation are essential to driving a #ResilientRecovery. Hear voices from across the world and send them your smile! 🙂 #IDAworks

node.text: Ayhan Kose, World Bank Prospects Group Director, joined #ExpertAnswers to discuss the latest edition of our Global Economic Prospects report. Listen to the conversation. #globaleconomy #economy #globaldevelopment #development #economists

node.title: How Will the COVID-19 Economic Recovery Play Out?

node.text:
For Indonesia, oceans are vital for its economy and welfare. With more than 17,500 islands and three-quarters of its territory at sea, oceans are central to Indonesia's prosperity. Yet, Indonesia's marine and coastal ecosystems and their economic value are under threat due to overfishing, degradation of mangroves and coral reefs, and marine debris. A sustainable ocean economy strategy can address these challenges, achieving healthy oceans, resilient coastal livelihoods and a thriving economy.

In this video, our partner @natgeoindonesia journeyed with us to the eastern ends of Indonesia to document the people of Raja Ampat, West Papua who have worked passionately to protect the oceans and empower its communities. To learn more http://ww.worldbank.org/oceansforprosperity 

#Indonesia
#OceansforProsperity 
#BeatPlasticPollution 
#BlueEconomy

node.text:
Marine pollution and climate change pose a threat to countries in #LatinAmerica and the #Caribbean. In #Belize the World Bank has supported a project, financed by @af_terg, to strengthen the resilience of the Belize Barrier Reef. The project helped to increase protection and restoration of ocean resources and to support livelihoods for the coastal communities. Learn more, copy and paste this link: http://wrld.bg/da8z50F3MKT

#UNWorldOceansDay #WorldOceanDay #WorldEnvironmentDay

node.title: Investing in Nature, Investing in the Future of Belize

node.text:
Administered by the @WorldBank, #PROBLUE_Oceans is a multi-donor trust fund dedicated to building a Blue Economy – one where everything we do in the ocean is integrated, sustainable, and protects our planet. Visit: http://worldbank.org/problue 

#UNWorldOceansDay #WorldOceanDay #WorldEnvironmentDay

node.title: PROBLUE: Healthy Oceans - Healthy Economies - Healthy Communities

node.text:
On International #BiodiversityDay, we are reminded that some of the best solutions to development challenges are found in nature 🌳🐝🐠🦋🦜. Nature creates jobs, improves resilience, is a key solution to climate change, and investing in nature makes economic sense. But how can we put biodiversity at the center of development?
 
But how can we put #biodiversity at the center or development? Here are a few ideas.
 
As we work to help countries achieve a green, inclusive, and resilient recovery from #COVID19, the World Bank has supported the creation and consolidation of more than 115 million hectares of marine, coastal and land protected areas.
 
Financing #ForNature is good for economies, communities and the planet 🌏✨.

node.title: Finding solutions to development challenges in nature.

node.text:
Conversation with Shirin (India), Tarik (Turkey) and Najya (The Netherlands) about their leaning experience during the COVID-19 pandemic and their ideas to improve it.

The pandemic has disrupted our lives, and is changing the way we live, work and learn and has spurred an education crisis. The World Bank estimates that an additional 72 million primary school age children will fall into learning poverty, due to extended school closures caused by the pandemic.
 
Read Shirin’s blog here: http://wrld.bg/nMVX50EOoAV
Read Tarik’s blog here: http://wrld.bg/LMUi50EOoUV
Read Najya’s blog here: http://wrld.bg/j9Hg50EOoww

#learningpoverty #education #Learning #schools #poverty

node.title: World Bank - Financial Times Blog Competition Winners

node.text:
The latest data from the World Bank shows that, despite the COVID-19 pandemic, the money sent home by migrants only fell by 1.6% in 2020. 
 

The commitment of migrants to continue with these payments despite difficult conditions, often married with government policies, helped support this vital lifeline for some of the world’s poorest people. 

 

In a special update for Expert Answers, World Bank Lead Economist for Migration and Remittances Dilip Ratha shares the latest research and explores the underlying reasons for this resilience.
#ExpertAnswers #remittances #jobs #mobilemoney

Speed is one of the main risk factors in road crashes and is often cited as being the leading contributor to death and serious injury on the world’s roads. How can we transform #StreetsforLife?
 
Join us for a LIVE conversation on May 19, 9 am ET ➡️ wrld.bg/xDg350EDJUf
#roadsafety #transport

Are you excited about #YouthDay? Show your support by replying 👏🏾!⁠
⁠
We'll be sharing some of our favorite content on Africa's youth. For instance, here are videos you can binge-watch. 👀 Check them out at the link in our profile bio! ⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Bank on August 11, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and text that says '#IMFyouth AUG 12 9:00 AM EDT New Perspectives on Innovation Co-hosted by the IMF's Young Professionals Group & World Bank Group's Youth-to-Youth Community Geoffrey Okamoto First Deputy Managing Director, IMF HAD KellyLovell Lovell CEO, BridgingTheGap Ventures Ryan RyanYost Yost Research ResearchAssistant,IMF Assistant, Tiffany Tong CEO, Aeloi Technologies'.

node.text:
Mark your calendars! 📅 📲 @Y2YWBG and #IMFYouth will be hosting an exciting event: “New Perspectives on Innovation” this Thursday, Aug 12th, at 9:00 AM Eastern Time. ⁠
⁠
Three young leaders – including @kellyalovell from @wearebridgingthegap and Tiffany Tong from @aeloitech – will share fresh takes on innovating across industries and sectors during the Covid-Era. The discussion will be moderated by @GWSOkamoto. See you there!⁠
⁠
The link to watch the event LIVE is in our bio. ⁠
#Y2Y #YouthDay #InternationalYouthDay⁠

Are you between 18 and 35 years old? We want to hear from you! ⁠
⁠

node.text:
Today, World Bank marks #IndigenousPeoplesDay!

We asked Indigenous leaders about some of the solutions emerging from their communities during COVID-19.

Hear what Pasang Dolma Sherpa, from Nepal, had to say. 

 #Road2Inclusion

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Bank on August 07, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.

node.text:
How did COVID-19 impact businesses led by women? ⁠
⁠
😷 A recent World Bank paper revealed that they were unequally affected when compared to businesses led by men. ⁠
⁠
📲 At the same time, women-led small and microbusinesses were much more likely to increase the use of digital platforms compared to those led by men. ⁠
⁠
👩🏾‍💼👩🏻‍🔧🧕👩🏽‍🍳 Tag a #FemaleEntrepreneur you admire and invite her to read the story in our profile bio!⁠

node.text:
The World Bank Group supports countries in the transition to a greener, more resilient economy by bringing finance, knowledge, and jobs. Our portfolio includes around 70 active projects supporting #biodiversity in more than 50 countries, with a net commitment amount of about US$1.18 billion. ⁠
⁠
Use the link in our profile bio to read more about the World Bank’s approach to biodiversity, as well as six proposed global response areas that could set economies on more sustainable pathways.⁠
⁠
#ForNature #InvestInNature #EcosystemServices

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Bank on August 05, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text.

node.text: NEWS: First shipment of #AVATT-acquired vaccines arrive in African countries. The @africanunion_officialpage, @AfricaCDC, UN Economic Commission for Africa, @afreximbankofficial, @UNICEF, and the @WorldBank teamed up to expedite the acquisition and distribution of vaccines throughout Africa and increase access to effective and safe #COVID19 vaccines. Use the link in our profile bio to learn more about how partners are coming together to end this pandemic! #Vaccines4All

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Bank on August 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'THE DEVELOPMENT PODCAST If we're not able to vaccinate everybody in the world soon, we could be in a situation where the pandemic is prolonged... This could go on for longer and it would affect the global economic recovery. Mamta Murthi Vice President, Human Development World Bank'.

node.text:
🎙️ NEW on the #DevelopmentPodcast: We discuss why many low-income countries are struggling to vaccinate their populations against #COVID19 and what's being done to help. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Listen from World Bank VP Mamta Murthi & @AfricaCDC Deputy Director Dr. Ahmed Ogwell to learn why it's critical we boost vaccination rates among the poorest and most vulnerable. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Go to the link in our bio to tune in now.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Bank on August 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'THE DEVELOPMENT PODCAST If we're not able to vaccinate everybody in the world soon, we could be in a situation where the pandemic is prolonged... This could go on for longer and it would affect the global economic recovery. Mamta Murthi Vice President, Human Development World Bank'.

Photo by World Bank on August 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'THE DEVELOPMENT PODCAST We need greater transparency around how many doses can be manufactured, who are these committed to, where are the surplus doses, so that we can have reallocation towards countries that need those doses. Mamta Murthi Vice President, Human Development World Bank'.

Photo by World Bank on August 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'THE DEVELOPMENT PODCAST We're doing a lot, both on vaccination, but also beyond vaccination on strengthening health systems, helping Africa become more resilient to climate change and supporting jobs and economic transformation in Africa. Mamta Murthi Vice President, Human Development World Bank'.

Photo by World Bank on August 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'THE DEVELOPMENT PODCAST We're workind with the African Union so that our financing can be used to ourchase 400 million doses that the African Union has managed to secure from Johnson & Johnson. Mamta Murthi Vice President, Human Development World Bank'.

node.text: The @WorldBank Group does not open individual bank accounts, have ATMs 🏧, or give personal loans 💳. So what are we? Our new series "Since you asked" 💬 answers YOUR questions!

node.text:
In #OurGreenerFuture, electric vehicles will be part of all cities. 🔌🚗 How do you feel about it? ⁠
⁠
Tell us 3 actions your country/community could take to build a greener, more inclusive future. If you're between 18-35 years old, use the link in bio to send us a video or photo!⁠

node.text:
Every day, rangers around the world risk their lives to protect #wildlife, their habitats and protected areas. They are the frontline defenders of #nature and today on #WorldRangerDay we are celebrating #rangers for their courage, bravery and determination. At the #GlobalWildlifeProgram funded by @gef_global_environment, we support rangers working in protected areas across 32 countries in Asia, Africa and Latin America. ⁠
⁠
This video showcases some of the activities that rangers do including wildlife monitoring, restoring habitat, confiscating illegal wildlife products, engaging communities, managing human-wildlife conflict intercepting poachers and combating wildlife crime. ⁠
⁠
Along with our partners @undp, @wwf, @thewcs, @adb_hq, @unep, @conservationorg, @traffic_wltrade, @cites @wildaid, we hope that the global community can join us in our admiration and gratitude for rangers. Use the link in our profile bio to learn more!
